newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani stocks end 2.12 pct up on devaluation.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani stocks end 2.12 pct up on devaluation.

text.p: Pakistani stocks ended sharply up on Tuesday on speculative buying triggered by the government devaluation of the rupee by 7.86 percent against the dollar, but dealers said the gains in the index were temporary.

"Stocks like Hub Power and PTCL that have GDR (Global Depositary Receipts) jumped after the devaluation," dealer Shakil Anwar said. "But ultimately, the devaluation will result in hyper-inflation and damage trade and industry." The Karachi Stock Exchange (KSE) 100-share index rose 29.01 points, or 2.12 percent, to end at 1,394.74. Gainers led losers 119-86. Turnover rose to 22.70 million shares from 16.80 million on Monday.
Hub Power rose 1.35 rupees to 32.35, PTCL 0.30 to 31.10, Pakistan State Oil 11 to 326 and Muslim Commercial Bank 2.50 to 40.50.
